subject: Physics
title: Multistage Rockets
description: Learn why rockets use multiple stages to reach higher velocities.

content.text: Multistage rockets discard empty fuel tanks to reduce mass and improve efficiency.

content.heading: Advantages of Staging
content.text: Each stage has its own engines and fuel. When one stage is exhausted, it detaches, allowing the next stage to fire with less mass.

content.heading: Two-Stage Rocket Example
content.problem: Stage 1: Δv₁ = 2000 m/s, Stage 2: Δv₂ = 2500 m/s. Find total Δv.

content.heading: Your Turn
problems: If Stage 1 gives 1500 and Stage 2 gives 2000, total Δv?
If Stage 1 gives 1800 and Stage 2 gives 2200, total Δv?
If Stage 1 = 2000, Stage 2 = 1500, Stage 3 = 1000, total Δv?
If one stage provides 40% of total Δv and equals 2000, total Δv?
If each of 3 stages provides 1800 Δv, total?
